title: How to Create a PST File in Outlook

steps.title: Open the Outlook app on your computer.
steps.content: Open the Outlook app on your computer. The Outlook icon looks like an "O" and a white envelope. You can find it on the Start menu, or on your desktop.

steps.title: Click the Home tab on the top-left.
steps.content: Click the Home tab on the top-left. This button is located in the upper-left corner of the app window. It will open your main tools on the toolbar ribbon.

steps.title: Click New Items on the Home toolbar.
steps.content: Click New Items on the Home toolbar. You can find this button on the far-left of the toolbar ribbon. It will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Hover over More Items on the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Hover over More Items on the drop-down menu. This will expand the menu, and show more options on the right.

steps.title: Select Outlook Data File on the More Items menu.
steps.content: Select Outlook Data File on the More Items menu. This will open a pop-up window titled "New Outlook Data File."

steps.title: Select Outlook data file (.pst) in the pop-up window.
steps.content: Select Outlook data file (.pst) in the pop-up window. When this option is selected, you can create and save a new PST data file from your mailbox.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will confirm your file type selection, and prompt you to select a saving location.

steps.title: Save your new PST data file.
steps.content: Save your new PST data file. Select a saving location in the file explorer window, and click OK to save your new file.
